title: As a PBE tester, I am ashamed to be one of the "very informed" who destroyed skarner's balance live
body:
_"It's tough. We also listened to the "**very informed**" testers who told us Skarner was weak. Feedback is always contingent upon the choices made by the playtester. In Mordekaiser's case, I felt the playtesters were not making the right choices but that over time they would begin to make them. I was incorrect. "_
- CertainlyT

**very informed.
**

This. this here hurts. Riot trusted us on the PBE to give informed data and feedback but we... no, I did not look at all the angles. I was one of the major voices on the forums that influenced the rework. I assumed my winning on the pbe with new skarner was not because he was unbalanced or broken, but because I lived and breathed that champion on live. And as one so used to that specific champion I never once took into account _"how would someone with NO experience with Skarner do?_". I now assume that this was the same mindset of the rest of the PBE testers as well. 

I have only played one game of skarner since he came live since then, and that was back when the win % hadn't become apparent. i couldn't even look at him after i realised what we had brought to LIVE. i dont know if ill play him again.

I have not been able to log onto the pbe forums, maybe my account got removed. And honestly? I deserve that if it is the case. We failed to give proper feedback from all the angles and now skarner will be dealt with accordingly . 

I'm sorry CertainlyT, I know you are not quick to take advice from the forums and one of the few times you do you get this... thing.
Had to get that off my chest. that is all.

Good luck on the fields of Justice!

replies.body:
I've said it ever since I first was allowed on the PBE; the PBE is not a good place to judge live balance.  I've played Garen for about five years and after testing the juggernaut changes I figured his win rate would bump up from 48% to 49 or 50%.  As we all know this didn't happen.

Everyone makes mistakes, and given the wildly different meta (or partial lack there of) on the PBE everything that comes off of it should come with a "results may vary" tag on it.  Mistakes are part of the learning experience.

I really hope CertainlyT didn't intend for that bit quoted to sound the way it does, because it reads as if he is trying to shift blame away from the balance team and onto the testers.  I'll say it again, mistakes happen, and no one is truly to blame for an honest mistake.

Changes were made, feedback was given, and it was a bad fit for the live server environment so future corrections will likely happen.  End of story.  There's no need for finger pointing.  We're all adults here after all.

And if you didn't mean it this way CertainlyT let me be the first to say I'm sorry for jumping to this conclusion.

And then you realize there are a ton of other things on the PBE that are true that get ignored. Gp was OP on PBE, and wasn't on live, but became OP as of recent. Sorta a sleeper pick. morde was bullsht on PBE, still bullsht now. Azir had tons of bugs, rito ignored them and released him.

what really sucks for the balance team is that only people who care about the champion in the first place will bother responding, researching, or testing them out. making balance hard as perceptions shall be skewed
By testers I don't think he **just** means PBE, they do have a big group of pro players that test out changes too.

Balancing for a game like LoL is a tough job (i've definitely been there and you're getting a small taste with pbe feedback). For a tester playing one game is very anecdotal: when you win, it feels like it was "all skill" but when you lose it feels like the champ is broken underpowered and there was nothing you could do. 

This is why we try our best to be scientific and consistent with our approach. Do we think X is OP? Let's dig deeper and see why or how that may be the case. Are PBE testers saying Y? What is causing that feeling, real power or just a bad game? 

Either way OP you're still great, and you should pick up skarner again he's fun!

Big PBE Tester here... for a long time, I actively tried to help push bugless content to live, and help with other issues.

I personally think that a big issue is that we don't have an official method of having it be pushed to the people who need to see it.  We just post it to the PBE forums/that one buglist topic and hope it gets noticed in the massive storm (Instance 1.  I reported a massive manamura bug where it would always get doublekills on "revive" champs with a 100% success rate after it was first introduced.  I reposted it several times, and held it on the front of the forums there for over a week.  Never gets fixed until nearly 2-3 months later on LIVE.)  Big one that comes to mind, but I've seen it time and time again, not only with mine, but with other people's post/issues, to the point I just sort of... stopped.  I understand that the PBE is shyt for balance.  That just comes from an enviroment where everywhere from challengers to bronze can mix freely and cause vastly different skill levels to intermingle, you can't even get a feel for balance.  Hell, you can't get a feel for balance on live until 1-2 weeks in, with an insanely larger sample size.

I think it's a thankless job but it does help. We scour those bug reports on the PBE forum and try to fix as many as we can. Also, I agree that pbe matchmaking is pretty loose, but that's just the given for a small testing environment.

PBE gave you tons of feedback on Cassiopeia, how the rework was poorly done, felt rushed, didn't meet what the champion was etc. You pushed it anyway. You ignored what was pretty much every single Cass player on PBE and rushed it anyway.
